intro: Condea floribunda, commonly known as the golden trumpet vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, yellow-orange, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces long, slender leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Condea floribunda is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
